Cloud Data Archiving for ClaimCenter

v081622.1

Lesson
objectives

¢ Describe key aspects of archiving in

Guidewire Cloud

Describe the steps required to enable
archiving

Configure archiving rules

Describe the bulk restore functions

Explain the purge process

Explain how privacy and GDPR compliance
are achieved

Data archiving overview

I Key business use cases G

Moves entities not required for daily operations to archive

Enhances application and database performance
Cloud supports scaling of archive for large data volumes

+ Returns entities from the archive to the operational database
22] Data retrieval + Supports governance and compliance requirements
C7 + Supports litigation, catastrophes, fraud, audits, amendments

Complies with GDPR/CCPA needs
Provides data privacy and security for archived data

64 Security and compliance

I Archiving in self-managed implementations Gi

_ Customer managed

+ Set up and manage batch jobs/queues

+ Privacy and security compliance

> GDPR

Archive process for Claims Gi

¢ Set DaysClosedBeforeArchive to a number of days (config.xml)
¢ ClaimClosed rule uses that to calculate DateEligibleForArchive
¢ Batch archive process only selects claims that are eligible

« Runs Gosu rules Claim Archiving rules

¢ If not skipped, then the claim is archived

sa configaem

ClaimCenter

I Gosu rules Gi

* ClaimClosed ruleset — sets DateEligibleForArchive property
when a claim is closed

¢ DefaultGroupClaimArchiving ruleset — skip a claim that: rule set

© Bit Rule Sets CB © Default Group Claim Archiving Rules

« Is not closed > bs ApprovaRoving 4) © Anco1000-caim state Rule

Is part of a bulk invoice that is not approved SSS 21 acoso - complete Review Re
> Pe iptenics €) G7 Anc06000 - Unsynced Review Rule

9) © ARc07000 - Transaction State Rule
8) G Anc08000 - subrogation Status Rule

* Has open activities Tian

* Has incomplete vendor reviews + tranny

* Has reviews not synched with ContactManager cn

¢ Has transactions yet to be escalated or acknowledged oad

* Has incomplete subrogation

¢ ArchivedClaimPurge ruleset — customer defined rules

Batch processes and plugin

Batch processes:

Archiving Item Writer

Bulk Purge

Restore Archived Claims

Access from: Server Tools -> Batch Process Info

Run manually or schedule in scheduler-config.xml

Plugin |ArchiveSource included in all InsuranceSuite applications — controls writing to
and retrieving from an archive data store

Restoring archived data

Why restore archived data? Gi

* To view detailed information for a claim (after archiving, only a summary is available
in the operational database)

¢ To add newly available information to a claim, or one of its related objects
¢ To satisfy changes in business or regulatory requirements

¢ To satisfy new reporting requirements

—_i=—_e£

archive store retrieved from InsuranceSuite
archive Cloud database

I Restoring data from the archive data store Gi

¢ Retrieves claims from archive and restores them to the ClaimCenter operational
database
¢ Existing capabilities:

« Search for and retrieve individual claims

=

¢« New capabilities: Le] ~
* Bulk restore

retrieve from

* Group restored claims together 7
archive

* Monitor progress

I Retrieve archived claims — single restore Gi

Advanced search screen provides an option to search the archive
« Enter search criteria and select a claim in the search results

Click Retrieve from Archive

Retrieve Archived Claims

S  Lessdate > Adjuster > Status >

10/18/2001 Andy Applegate Archived

I Retrieve archived claims — bulk restore (1 of3) Gi

Select the Administration tab (administrative rights required)
* Select Utilities -> Restore Archived Claims in Bulk -> Bulk Restore Claims Records in the menu pane
* Click New Restore with Claim Numbers

i |¥ Dashboard Teom | Administration | v | Vacation

Bulk Restore Claims Records

Existing Restorations

#
Summary Description > Date Created >

No data to display

I Retrieve archived claims — bulk restore (2of3)
¢ Enter a value in Restore Summary to identify the restore request

* Select how claim numbers will be provided

« Restore the claims
Gi Claimcenter

Desktop | ¥ ¥ .

I Retrieve archived claims — bulk restore (30F3) Gi
¢ Monitor the restore request as it is processed

* Click Refresh for updates

Bulk Restore Claims Record Details kk

I Restored claim associations Gi

Records page

* Click the request name to view the details

Claims Archive State

000.00-000087 Restored

000-00-000088 Restored

I Archived claim retrieval configuration parameters

MaxNumberOfArchivedEntitiesToRestore parameter in config.xml:
* Specifies the maximum number of entities allowed per bulk restore request

« Refers to the number of claims to be retrieved
Bi centgaml

<paran nane="DaysRetrievedBeforeArchive” value="100"/>

<paran nane="RestorePattern” value="restore"/>

="MaxNuaberOfArchivedEntitiesToRestore™ value="2000"/>

Data model changes (1 of2) Gi

« Archived data may span multiple versions of a data model
¢ ClaimCenter checks the data model version during the restore
¢ Ifitis an earlier version, ClaimCenter runs upgrade triggers on the object
¢ Upgrade triggers are:
* Built-in upgrade triggers for Guidewire data model changes (Guidewire built)
* Custom upgrade triggers for customer data model changes (customer built)

¢ After all upgrade triggers are successful, the object is converted into a real entity
instance

¢ Ifthe upgrade fails, the entire restore process fails

Data model changes @of2) Gi

« For data model changes:

+ Use IDataModelChange interface

¢ Implement DatabaseUpgradeVersionTrigger for database upgrades

¢ Implement ArchivedDocumentUpgradeVersionTrigger for archived document upgrades
¢ Implement both triggers when any data model changes are made

¢ Implementing as you go keeps data upgrade and archive retrievals in sync with the
current data model

¢ The upgrade operates on one XML document at a time
* See Gosu documentation for more details

Purge archived data

Purging data — ClaimCenter only Gi

When data is past its useful life

When data is past regulatory and retention
requirements

Is a permanent action
Supported by two-step ruleset

¢ A flag is set during the archive process (eligible for archive) |

« Aruleset checks again for eligibility at time of purge ii]
Customer can configure rulesets to manage the purge A
Purge is disabled by default and must be enabled in
config.xml AWS s3 Purge

Purging claims Gi

¢ MarkArchivedEntityPurgeReady work queue runs ArchiveClaimPurge ruleset
¢ ArchiveClaimPurge ruleset provides additional filters for preventing purge
¢ Archived claims that pass the rules are marked for purge

¢ Bulk Purge purges those claims marked for purge

a ae Op

AWS S3 MarkArchived AWS S3 Bulk
Archived EntityPurgeR Archived Purge
claims eady claims

Eb

I Data security and privacy

¢ Archived data is stored in AWS S3
¢« AWS S3 ensures data security and privacy
¢ Archived data is also GDPR compliant
¢ Data destruction for GDPR:
* Destroys data in the archive (AWS S3)

¢ Destroys data in live database (Aurora)

Lesson
objectives
review

¢ Describe key aspects of archiving in

Guidewire Cloud

¢ Describe the steps required to enable

archiving

Configure archiving rules

Describe the bulk restore functions

Explain the purge process

Explain how privacy and GDPR compliance
are achieved
